Issues.Title: designer form doesn't take care about window state Activation
Issues.Body:

Version 16.11.20

### .NET version

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

### Issue description

designer doesn't take care about window state Activation state of form

Issues.Title: Use IStorage*/IStream* Instead of Interface
Issues.Body:
- Use IStream*/IStorage* instead of interface where appropriate
- Convert `CreateILockBytesOnHGlobal`,`GetHGlobalFromILockBytes`,`StgCreateDocfileOnILockBytes`,`StgOpenStorageOnILockBytes` to cswin32
- Remove LockBytesWrapper
- Implement basic dispose pattern in AxHost.State to release unmanaged resources
- Update IPersistStorage::Load/Save methods to return correct HRESULT value

Issues.Title: Tacking issue:  Anchors in PermonV2 mode become invalid
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

N0. This new way of calculation is introduced in 8.0

### Issue description

In PermonitorV2 mode applications, when moving the Form from one monitor to the other, Form gets an invalid display rectangle for a brief period during the scaling of its child controls. Updating anchors, because of layout, during this period would end up invalid anchor calculations. For all scaling scenarios due to DPI changed event, we will be scaling anchors and avoid/skip recalculation of anchors and prevent using this invalid display rect.

Following is the snippet where we see invalid DisplayRect of the Form for a brief period while moving from one monitor to the other.

Invalid sate: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199294442-45913402-1ee9-4f41-b6e0-c69f1b2f44c6.png)

Final state:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199294510-e6d0f70d-6520-41da-800b-4677a1b99d23.png)


### Steps to reproduce

NA
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tacking issue:  Anchors in PermonV2 mode become invalid" (#8087)

Issues.Title: Fix Anchors in PermonitorV2 mode applications.
Issues.Body:
fixes: #8087

In PermonitorV2 mode applications, when moving the Form from one monitor to the other, Form gets an invalid display rectangle for a brief period during the scaling of its child controls. Updating anchors, because of layout, during this period would end up invalid anchor calculations. For all scaling scenarios due to DPI changed event, we will be scaling anchors and avoid/skip recalculation of anchors to prevent using this invalid display rect.

Following is the snippet where we see invalid DisplayRect of the Form for a brief period while moving from one monitor to the other.

**Invalid state:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199293490-967c0fe3-324f-47b0-89ec-8340890dd834.png)

**Final state:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199293757-999100ae-cef0-4083-8e53-f50148fb6cf4.png)


Amending #7956 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8086)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix Anchors in PermonitorV2 mode applications." (#8086)

Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7980


## Proposed changes

- Disabled checkmark is now rendered with the same code as other disabled images on ToolStrip
 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Better visual difference between enabled and disabled menu items

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

![after_win10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/199568463-1ce9c54f-0296-4052-945c-2e4c591fe951.png)

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.2.22477.23
- Windows 11

Issues.Title: Fix CodeQL TSA reporting
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

## Proposed changes

Fix CodeQL 3000 configuration to 

1. properly pass intent to publish results to TSA 
2. properly discover TSA configuration file

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

None

## Regression? 

No

## Risk

None

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

This is the same pattern Arcade uses. I've also confirmed this specific configuration by build logs:


Build [20221031.1](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build/results?buildId=2033070&view=logs&j=eb2c8817-e906-5459-8080-1a4c8ed1e2e2&t=3d80e413-4872-527d-85b5-8fd7d891cc14) is a regular, scheduled build and scan. This build also shows the problem. The `CodeQLInit` task logging shows that `TSAEnabled` was not correctly detected (and thus set to false).

```
...
Configuration:
Cadence = 0
Enabled = true
LogLevel = 4
CLIVersion = 2.8.4
TSAEnabled = false
...
```

Build [20221101.2](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build/results?buildId=2034406&view=results) is a build of this PR branch. It shows resolution of both issues. 

Correctly detecting the desired configuration:

```
...
Configuration:
Cadence = 0
Enabled = true
LogLevel = 4
CLIVersion = 2.8.4
TSAEnabled = true
TSAOptionsPath = D:\a\_work\1\s\eng\pipelines\tsaoptions.json
...
```

Finding and loading the TSA configuration file:

```
...
Looking for TSA options in D:\a\_work\1\s\eng\pipelines\tsaoptions.json
##[verbose]Loading TSA options from D:\a\_work\1\s\eng\pipelines\tsaoptions.json
...
```
 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

Test builds run using the configuration defined in the `azure-pipelines-codeql.yml` pipeline definition and the `dotnet-winforms-codeql` pipeline.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8093)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix CodeQL TSA reporting" (#8093)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22551.5

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, repro in previous all versions

### Issue description

Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder

.Net 8.0:
![Form_8 0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199459985-975bbdb1-7d79-4352-be20-62a328bb71b2.gif)

.Net framework 4.8.1:
![Form_framework481](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/199460019-0ae99a21-1f4a-4899-9de0-d45e3151d622.gif)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .net application with targeting .net 8.0
2. Build application
3. In file explorer, find this application and go to debug->**net8.0-windows** folder
4. Launch Narrator and click app's exe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Form cannot be focused and announced by Narrator automatically when launching app's exe from debug folder" (#8098)

Issues.Title: winforms databound usercontrol causes rowchanged event
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/winforms-databound-usercontrol-causes-ro/10185137)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
When a win forms usercontrol is data bound to a datatable. It causes the datarow to be modified EVEN when no data has been changed.
This is causing a big performance issue in my application.

I have created a test application which I have attached to demonstrate the problem.
I have tried many things but cannot resolve it. I don't know where the problem is.

Test 1 - Tests data binding with a standard textbox. It is bound to the source table. The DataTable has a RowChanged event handler to display the table change count and display the row versions with data. This does not cause any rowchanges.

Test 2 - Tests data binding with a User Control. Note: This user control is a dummy version used to demonstrate my problem. This si bound to the same data table as etst 1 and the same source column. This test causes each row to be modified, as show by the display of the DataRow values.

In both tests, the results are displayed in a textbox on the form.

Can you help.
How can I stop rows being changed when there is not data modified.

Thankyou in advance.
Glynn.

---
### Original Comments

#### Feedback Bot on 10/31/2022, 11:33 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### Melon Wang [MSFT] on 11/1/2022, 03:06 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)
#### glynn.stuber on 11/1/2022, 04:35 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

Issues.Title: UserCOntrol with anchored controls does not work on high dpi machines.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

NO

### Issue description

Adding a user control, that has anchored controls, to the Form and launching on high dpi scaled  (300%) monitor, doesn't display/scale anchored controls form the user control properly.

Actual: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199304682-1090599b-34b6-402e-a6bf-1802d1bad3ef.png)

Expected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199304760-b69ad16a-8961-4089-ac05-d73793df6245.png)


### Steps to reproduce


Create a user control with anchored buttons as shown above and add it to the Form. Target framework does not matter here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UserCOntrol with anchored controls does not work on high dpi machines." (#8088)

Issues.Title: Anchored controls layout is broken if Container has visible scrollbars
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No.

### Issue description

Applications running in PermonitorV2 mode and has scroll bars visible, anchoring child controls results in incorrect layout when moved to different monitor. Following image shows the issue in detail:

scenario:  Application moved from 100% monitor to 300% monitor.
Actual: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199310722-ff0018e5-de17-4387-a2d6-3a3c26603433.png)

Expected:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199312440-689ca1fe-e385-4d6d-a074-b9de07d7fd14.png)


### Steps to reproduce

- Create a PMv2 app with anchored controls as shown in images above.
- Run the app on a dual monitor setup with 100% and 300% scaling on them.
- Move application from one monitor to the other.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Anchored controls layout is broken if Container has visible scrollbars" (#8090)

Issues.Title: Controls on the Form are truncated on high dpi machines.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0 

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

NO

### Issue description

In PermonitorV2 mode application, child controls placed on the Form, close to border are cut when moved from one monitor to the other with different DPI scaling. It is more evident in anchored controls.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a simple Form with child controls placed around the border as shown in below pic.
- Set application Dpi mode to PermonitorV2 mode. And run application on a dual monitor with settings 300% primary and 100% secondary.

Actual: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199310019-4cd79fae-e3fc-4f98-8778-9dc1c1019484.png)

Expected: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36968667/199310071-2bf241fe-d250-4fce-9b0e-4bcb19d06c19.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Controls on the Form are truncated on high dpi machines." (#8089)

Issues.Title: Winforms Designer - Failed to launch the designer server process
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio Professional 2019  - 16.11

### .NET version

.NetCore - 3.1

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

In the Winforms project after using “Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost” and setting Platforms is “X64; X86” in the Winforms Netcore project, unable to open the form designer.

please find my source code from the link - [Winforms_Uwp_App](https://drive.google.com/file/d/12xUSk4D5ZD7dp0b3kg4bcBSuEH3H4-29/view)

### Steps to reproduce

I have already reported to the Visual Studio developer community.
please find the discussion [here](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Winforms-Failed-to-launch-the-designer-s/10100679).
Please find the video for more info - [video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55428663/184504506-366a66be-cd6e-4312-bd68-bb0a9475db28.mp4)

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms Designer - Failed to launch the designer server process" (#8082)
